result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher S Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher S Brown is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher S Brown was found guilty of 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).
  • Christopher S Brown was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 30 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victim's family (person, property or residence).  Comply with Child Support orders.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Body Armor warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 15 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: Ct. 1

Guilty - both counts

Ct 1: 940.06(1)-2nd Degree Reckless Homicide; Ct 2: 2nd Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety. 

             **DEFENDANT TO BE HELD WITHOUT BOND PENDING SENTENCING**
Sentencing hearing on August 4, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Christopher S Brown in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Defendant Christopher S Brown in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Leslie Johnson.
The jury sent a question to the Judge inquiring as to what a 'reasonable effort' is as they cannot unanimously agree on a verdict. The Judge instructs the jury to deliberate a little while longer.

2:25 pm-verdict is reached. The jury finds the defendant Guilty of 2nd degree reckless homicide and guilty of 2nd degree recklessly endangering safety. The jury is polled.

State moves for judgments on verdicts
Defense moves for judgments not withstanding the verdicts

The State moves the Court to revoke bond

BTC: guilty. PSI ordered. Defendant to be held without bond pending sentencing.

Defendant Christopher S Brown in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Defendant Christopher S Brown in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.`
State calls Criminalist Todd Hoover - DSAT. Direct by State. State marks Ex #16-projectile removed from body of victim. State moves #16 into evidence/received. No Cross. State calls Inv. Joseph Spaulding - DSAT. Direct by State. State moves Ex 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 9, & 10 into evidence/received. Cross by Defense. State calls Mark Simonson, Tool mark examiner - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #19-Statement of qualifications of Mark Simonson, Ex #20-Report of Mark Simonson. Cross by Defense. State moves Ex #19, 20, 1, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15, 16, 17, 18, 21, 23, 24, 24a, 25, 26 & 27. No objection subject to prior rulings/received. The State rests. Defense moves to dismiss, specifically Ct 3, due to the State's failure to meet it's burden of proof. State objects. BTC: Motion to dismiss is denied regarding Cts 1 & 2. Ct 3 is dismissed on defense motion. Mr. Hart indicates that the defendant has chosen not to testify and therefore, the Defense rests. The Court has colloquy with defendant. BTC: The defendant freely, knowingly, voluntarily waives his right to testify. Parties are reviewing instructions. Mr. Repischak gives closing arguments for the State. Mr. Hart gives closing arguments for Defense. Mr. Repischak gives rebuttal for the State.  The Court instructs the jury. Names tumbled; alternates chosen.  Jury begins deliberations at 2:36 pm. Jury continues to deliberate at 5:05 pm; excused for the evening. The Court will reconvene at 8:30 am tomorrow.

Defendant Christopher S Brown in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Defendant Christopher S Brown in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
State calls MG - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #6-photo lineup photos. Cross by defense. State marks Ex #21-Stipulation of parties. Moved into evidence/received. State calls RG - DSAT. Direct by State. State marks Ex #8-Statement of RG. Moved into evidence/received. Cross by defense. State calls MR - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #7-black gun case. State marks Ex #14-Gun frame, #15-Gun slide. Cross by defense. State calls Officer Christopher Kupper - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #23-Report of Officer Kupper. Cross by defense. Ms. Hoelzel is present with DL regarding contempt proceedings. The witness has agreed to testify today and the State will voir dire the witness outside the presence of the jury. If the witness testify truthfully, the Court will consider that a mitigating factor and will take that into consideration regarding the contempt sanctions. Voir dire by both State and Defense. State calls AR - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #9-Statement of AR. Cross xam by Defense. State marks Ex #10-letter sent to CB to DB. State moves #10 into evidence/received. Cross xam by Defense. State calls YS - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross by Defense. State calls Officer Eric Prybylski - DSAT. Direct by the State. No cross by Defense. State calls DW - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross xam by Defense. The State calls Officer Jacob Smetana - DSAT. Direct by the State. State calls Officer Dennis Cecchini - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #13 - Gray hoodie. Cross xam by Defense. State calls Officer Chad Anderson - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross xam by Defense. State calls Officer Jon Pomeroy - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross by defense. State calls Officer Gary Neubauer - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross xam by Defense. State calls Officer David Funderburk - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #26 & 27-photos of injuries. State moves #26 & 27 into evidence/received & published. State calls Inv. Chad Stillman - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross xam by Defense. State's last witnesses are not availble until tomorrow.

BTC: sanctions against DL are waived
Exhibits 1-27.     BOX 266

Defendant Christopher  S Brown in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Defendant Christopher S Brown in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Preliminary matters put on the record. Jury enters, Oath #1 given. Mr. Repischak introduces self, members of his office and potential witnesses. Mr. Hart introduces self, members of his office and potential witnesses. Mr. Repischak readse/ information to the jury. 
Voir dire by the Court. Voir dire by Mr. Repischak, for the State. Voir dire by Mr. Hart for the defense. Parties exercise their peremptory challenges. The jury is chosen. No objection to the jury as chosen.
jury enters the courtroom, Oath #2 given. The Court reads preliminary instructions to the jury. Mr. Repischak gives opening statements for the State. Mr. Hart gives opening statements for the Defense.  State calls VV - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross xam by defense. State moves Ex #1 into evidence/received. State calls DL - DSAT. The Court conducts colloquy with deft. The Court will appoint an attorney for the witness. The Court holds the witness in contempt. 

BTC: The witness being called to testify in this case is found in contempt. DL, D.O.B. 09-21-1992. The Court sanctions the witness with $500.00 and 30 days RCJ. -0- DTP. FTP - 30 days RCJ. 

State calls AB - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #3-Facebook photo; #4-photo lineup photos/photo of deft. Cross exam by defense. State calls SB - Direct by the State. Cross by defense. State calls RS - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #5-photo lineup. Cross by defense.
